net.kuujo.vertigo.cluster

Class XyncClusterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kuujo.vertigo.cluster.XyncClusterManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClusterManager

    public class XyncClusterManager
extends Object
    Xync-based cluster manager implementation.

    The Xync cluster manager is backed by XyncCluster which relies upon the Xync event bus API for fault-tolerant deployments and Hazelcast data structure access. This means the Xync cluster manager depends upon the Xync platform manager or a similar event bus API for operation.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

      • getNetwork

        public ClusterManager getNetwork(String name,
                        org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<ActiveNetwork>> resultHandler)
        Description copied from interface: ClusterManager
        Gets a network reference for a deployed network.

        If the network is running in the cluster then an ActiveNetwork instance will be returned to the asynchronous handler. The ActiveNetwork can be used to arbitrarily and asynchronously alter the structure of the running network.

        Specified by:
        getNetwork in interface ClusterManager
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to get.
        resultHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called with the result. If the network exists then an ActiveNetwork instance which references the running network will be provided, otherwise, the result will be null
        Returns:
        The cluster manager.

      • deployNetwork

        public ClusterManager deployNetwork(String name)
        Description copied from interface: ClusterManager
        Deploys an empty network to the cluster.

        This method deploys a no-component network to the cluster. This can be useful if another verticle needs to reference and update the running network asynchronously rather than deploying a predefined network.

        Specified by:
        deployNetwork in interface ClusterManager
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to deploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster manager.

      • deployNetwork

        public ClusterManager deployNetwork(String name,
                           org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<ActiveNetwork>> doneHandler)
        Description copied from interface: ClusterManager
        Deploys an empty network to the cluster.

        This method deploys a no-component network to the cluster. This can be useful if you want to reference and update the running network asynchronously using the ActiveNetwork rather than deploying a predefined network.

        Specified by:
        deployNetwork in interface ClusterManager
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to deploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the deployment is complete.
        Returns:
        The cluster manager.

      • deployNetwork

        public ClusterManager deployNetwork(NetworkConfig network)
        Description copied from interface: ClusterManager
        Deploys a network to the cluster.

        If the given network configuration's name matches the name of a network that is already running in the cluster then the given configuration will be merged with the running network's configuration. This allows networks to be dynamically updated with partial configurations. If the configuration matches the already running configuration then no changes will occur, so it's not necessary to check whether a network is already running if the configuration has not been altered.

        Specified by:
        deployNetwork in interface ClusterManager
        Parameters:
        network - The configuration of the network to deploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster manager.

      • deployNetwork

        public ClusterManager deployNetwork(NetworkConfig network,
                           org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<ActiveNetwork>> doneHandler)
        Description copied from interface: ClusterManager
        Deploys a network to the cluster.

        If the given network configuration's name matches the name of a network that is already running in the cluster then the given configuration will be merged with the running network's configuration. This allows networks to be dynamically updated with partial configurations. If the configuration matches the already running configuration then no changes will occur, so it's not necessary to check whether a network is already running if the configuration has not been altered.

        Specified by:
        deployNetwork in interface ClusterManager
        Parameters:
        network - The configuration of the network to deploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the deployment is complete. The handler will be called with an ActiveNetwork instance that references the running network. The ActiveNetwork can be used to arbitrarily and asynchronously update the live network configuration.
        Returns:
        The cluster manager.

      • undeployNetwork

        public ClusterManager undeployNetwork(String name)
        Description copied from interface: ClusterManager
        Undeploys a complete network from the cluster.

        This method does not require a network configuration for undeployment. Vertigo will load the configuration from the fault-tolerant data store and undeploy components internally. This allows networks to be undeployed without the network configuration.

        Specified by:
        undeployNetwork in interface ClusterManager
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to undeploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster manager.

      • undeployNetwork

        public ClusterManager undeployNetwork(String name,
                             org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Description copied from interface: ClusterManager
        Undeploys a complete network from the cluster.

        This method does not require a network configuration for undeployment. Vertigo will load the configuration from the fault-tolerant data store and undeploy components internally. This allows networks to be undeployed without the network configuration.

        Specified by:
        undeployNetwork in interface ClusterManager
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to undeploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the network is undeployed.
        Returns:
        The cluster manager.

      • undeployNetwork

        public ClusterManager undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig network)
        Description copied from interface: ClusterManager
        Undeploys a network from the cluster.

        This method supports both partial and complete undeployment of networks. When undeploying networks by specifying a NetworkConfig, the network configuration should contain all components and connections that are being undeployed. If the configuration's components and connections match all deployed components and connections then the entire network will be undeployed.

        Specified by:
        undeployNetwork in interface ClusterManager
        Parameters:
        network - The network configuration to undeploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster manager.

        Description copied from interface: ClusterManager
        Undeploys a network from the cluster.

When undeploying networks by specifying a NetworkConfig, the network configuration should contain all components and connections that are being undeployed. If the configuration's components and connections match all deployed components and connections then the entire network will be undeployed.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the network is undeployed.
        Returns:
